All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Collection, java.util.List, java.lang.Runnable, java.io.Serializable
public class LocalQueue
extends JobQueue
implements java.lang.Runnable

This class is used by the workers. It acts as a very small private job queue That pre-fetches one or more jobs to keep the cpu busy and minimize IO wait.
This class was later added after the IO wait proved to prevent efficient scaling especially with increased workers and jobs.

Author:
Erik van Zijst - erik@prutser.cx - 10.jan.2003
See Also:

Constructor Detail

LocalQueue

public LocalQueue(JobManager jobManager,
                  int capacity)
Creates a new local job queue that actively pre-fetches jobs from the central job queue at the job manager with a daemon thread.

The local queue's daemon thread is automatically started.

Parameters:
jobManager - local or remote reference (stub) to the central job manager.
capacity - the local queue's capacity (number of pre-fetched jobs).
Method Detail

open

public void open()
Description copied from class: JobQueue
Call this method after the queue has been closed to re-open it for input.
The get() method will no longer throw the OutOfWorkException and block util a job is available.

Overrides:
open in class JobQueue

run

public void run()
Specified by:
